title: GreatArkansas
author: GreatArkansas
content: Hi everyone, can anyone suggest to me some Bitcoin explorers that will show useful information like the price of Bitcoin when the transaction is created and also the amount in USD transacted,For example: in a transaction, multiple addresses sent x amount of Bitcoin, so I need to know how much in USD that was sent to each address/es.

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on December 14, 2023, 12:17:40 AMhttps://blockchair.com can do that.Blockchain doesn't have this "Price of Bitcoin when the transaction was created".Here in the screenshot from a random transaction I saw in Blockchain, you will only see the USD value at the time of the transaction. I know we can calculate the price  of Bitcoin during the time of the transaction if we have this "USD value at the time of transaction" but it's not really convenient, maybe  there's some explorer that it will show you.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: GreatArkansas on December 14, 2023, 12:42:17 AMBlockchain doesn't have this "Price of Bitcoin when the transaction was created".Here in the screenshot from a random transaction I saw in Blockchain, you will only see the USD value at the time of the transaction. I know we can calculate the price  of Bitcoin during the time of the transaction if we have this "USD value at the time of transaction" but it's not really convenient, maybe  there's some explorer that it will show you.Blockchain.com explorer can provide you similar information for total value of a transaction at the time it was created, like Blockchair.com. It seems Blockchain.com explorer changed their feature recently as when I wrote this post, I checked it again and saw that today the Blockchain.com explorer no longer provide a value of a transaction at the time it was created like the explorer shown before their latest change. Now it shows the value of a past transaction with a price of bitcoin at the moment.I thought you want this before you made this reply and I checked all explorers in List of useful Bitcoin block explorers and did not find any explorer can help you.This block explorer is interesting for coders https://yogh.io/tx/8c14f0db3df150123e6f3dbbf30f8b955a8249b62ac1d1ff16284aefa3d06d87/It breaks down the raw transaction.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: I checked the list and it seems most explorers only show the USD value at the time of the transaction. OKlink is the other one who does this. Maybe we can inspect the element and see the script to see how they calculate the price and modify it depending on what we need. I checked Blockchair APIs and can't find how to do it the easiest way either. Seems like they only offer the market price for each request instead of the price at the time the transaction was made. CMIIW.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I did a little checking myself and found nothing like what you're looking for. As far as "the amount in USD transacted" during the time of the transaction itself is concerned, I guess you already know that blockchair.com provides it. What I can't find is "the price of Bitcoin when the transaction is created." Blockchain.com has this advance details of previous transactions like the hash, block, time, age, fee, size, weight, and so on, but it's a bit funny and pointless when it comes to the BTC price because they're providing the current price. I wonder why they have to add that detail in old transactions when it's reflecting the real-time price anyway.

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: How can it's possible in the first place? explorer only record the time when the transaction is already confirmed, only unconfirmed transaction they will show when the transaction was created. If they didn't record the time, they also wouldn't show the USD equivalent when the transaction was created.I feel like the difference wouldn't be that "big", even different explorers will show different USD equivalent since they use their own rates.

comments.author: MusaMohamed
comments.body: Quote from: Apocollapse on December 14, 2023, 03:56:35 AMHow can it's possible in the first place? explorer only record the time when the transaction is already confirmed, only unconfirmed transaction they will show when the transaction was created. If they didn't record the time, they also wouldn't show the USD equivalent when the transaction was created..They can do this if they want and they can use average price of Bitcoin for all transactions in a same day. I mean all Bitcoin blocks and related transactions that were confirmed in a same day will be applied with Bitcoin price on that day.They can use this price tag method that is not 100% accurate but they can note it in their method and I believe no user will complain. With a note on this, users will know the method and its pros and cons and having a price on a day that transaction was confirmed is better than a today price of Bitcon for value of a 10-years old transaction with today price, not with past price.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: I actually looked into this a few years ago and I also had the same issue. The block explorer didn’t show the price when it took place.I basically had to manually convert the price, it was a lot of work. Don’t know why they don’t do it. Most likely because people want to know the current rate instead of the historical.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: https://bitinfocharts.com can do this, but price details are displayed if you search by wallet address, not by txid. It just doesn't have the tx confirmed count details, I don't think that's what you need.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: It looks like this explorer gives you what you expect https://btc1.trezor.io/, you just need to place your cursor in the Bitcoin amount of the transaction, the price will appear when the transaction was made and the current price in USD.Blockchain.com also has such a feature but has changed it recently.

comments.author: johnsaributua
comments.body: Indeed, if there is a price that is executed when bitcoin is confirmed, it will be easier in general, of course if there are other currencies it will also be very easy but maybe sometime in the future, it could also be because it is a form of anonymity too.  CMIW, maybe we should know usd with those stored in wallets or in exchangers only because it is more potential hodl or activity paid or trading, in the number of bitcoins that can be traded, not in explorer because it is a checking account (I like its transparency). I don't pay attention to that sir, because every bitcoin shipment that is sent I only see the hash and transaction quickly, I am more often manual just to simulate converting to other currencies with cmc or coin gecko, even though it only calculates fee  For me, explorer is simple and brings out the important things without reducing its personal / sensitive nature, that's what I think has the characteristics of explorer technology and is awesome.
